title: Tempe restord A masque presented by the Queene, and foureteene ladies, to the Kings Maiestie at Whitehall on Shrove-Tuesday. 1631.
author: Townshend, Aurelian, fl. 1601-1643.
publisher: Printed by A[ugustine] M[athewes] for Robert Allet [i.e. Allot], and George Bakek [i.e. Baker],
notes: The songs are by Aurelian Townshend, whose name appears on C3r. The rest is by Inigo Jones, with portions derived from: Beaujoyeulx, Baltasar de.  Balet comique de la royne.
The play was performed on 14 Feb. 1632.
Quire B comes in three states involving rearrangement and some resetting of type. See "Aurelian Townshend's poems and masks" (ed. E.K. Chambers), p. 118-9.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
